txt.en:
'Pardon me, my good [placeholder], but can you help an Eglan far from his home out? I am having the worst luck! The bag what was holding my marbles split open, and by the time I noticed it, all the marbles were gone. 

'Then, even worse, is that I saw a beast out in the snows there gobble one up! And I do not think it was the only marble what was lost that way either.

'It is a bit disgusting, I would agree, but I need those marbles back. A burglar needs his whole bag of tricks! Bring me back my marbles -- you will have to dig through more than one kind of creature's stomach, I would wager.'
'Ah, thank goodness! I missed these things -- want to watch me juggle them? No? Ah well.\n\n'Unfortunately, the missing marbles have not been the worst of my troubles....'
'Where are my marbles? You have not had any luck?'
Warstang, a burglar currently residing in Zigilgund, has lost his marbles -- they seem to have been scattered and eaten by various beasts -- and wants your help recovering them.

You may find the beasts that ate Warstang's marbles scattered throughout Länsi-mâ.\n\nFind Warstang's lost marbles in the bellies of the beasts who ate them and return them to him at the dwarf-outpost of Zigilgund.
